project.teaser: Microalgae were always an exciting target for Aquaculture and Biotechnology, as they represent a largely untapped reservoir of novel and valuable bioactive compounds. ALGAE4A-B (ALGAE For Aquaculture and Beauty) project seeks to exploit the microalgae diversity, as a source...
project.objective: Microalgae were always an exciting target for Aquaculture and Biotechnology, as they represent a largely untapped reservoir of novel and valuable bioactive compounds. ALGAE4A-B (ALGAE For Aquaculture and Beauty) project seeks to exploit the microalgae diversity, as a source for state-of-the art high-added-value biomolecules in aquaculture and cosmetics. The diversification of microalgae biomass production towards two independent applications will allow the microalgae industry to gain access to alternative markets in an uncertain, highly competitive and fast changing commercial environment. The project will combine both basic and applied multidisciplinary research in the fields of –omics technologies, biochemistry and applied biotechnology in order to: a) Develop and optimize of low input and application-based microalgae culture systems, b) Develop of “-omic” resources for both microalgae and fishes, c) Develop of downstream processing of high value added products from microalgae, with an emphasis in polysaccharides, proteins, enzymes, antioxidants, d) Develop, formulate and in vitro evaluate a new range of cosmetic and nutraceutical products for aquaculture. The implementation of the project will offer the industrial partners the opportunity to translate scientific research into well defined knowledge-based end products and analytical tools. Apart from scientific objectives the ALGAE4A-B will provide a platform for an efficient dissemination, transfer of knowledge and training between academic, commercial partners and society. Overall, ALGAE4A-B aspires to foster both the European capacity building and the strategic objectives of EU Blue Growth and Marine Biotechnology to harness the untapped potential of Europe's seas and coasts for training and sustainable growth.
project.title: Development of Microalgae-based novel high added-value products for the Cosmetic and Aquaculture industry

article.title: Sustainable beauty products from microalgae give blue economy a makeover
article.teaser: Microalgae represent a largely untapped resource of valuable bioactive compounds that can be used in both the cosmetics and aquaculture industry. An EU initiative investigated microalgae to harness their potential for scientific discovery and sustainable growth.

result.title: Transcriptome associated with novel bioactive products in fish
result.description: Report on the transcriptome analysis of larval stages and immune-related genes. High-throughput expression analysis will be performed on fish samples supplied with the bioactive compounds to evaluate regulatory pathways, using RNAseq technology

result.title: Stimulation of growth by methanol
result.description: Report on the effect of microalgae biomass production under mixotrophic conditions by addition of selected concentrations of methanol into the growth medium.

result.title: Transcriptome associated with novel bioactive products in microalgae
result.description: Report on the transcriptome analysis of selected microalgae strains grown under differential environmental and nutritional regimes associated with novel bioactive products, using RNAseq technology

result.title: In vitro toxicity assessments of microalgae extracts or compounds
result.description: Report on in vitro toxicity assessment of microalgae extracts or compounds using human dermal keratinocytes and normal human fibroblasts cell cultures

result.title: Report on the quality control of the cosmeceutical products
result.description: Report on the quality control of the cosmeceutical products at different storage conditions by using optical and physicochemical methods and microbiological testing.

result.title: Optimal conditions of photonic quality
result.description: Report on the optimization of microalgae biomass production under different light wavelengths, including white light, red light, green light and blue light.

result.title: Metabolomic profile of microalgae under different culture regimes
result.description: Report on the accumulation of a wide range of compounds spanning both primary and secondary metabolism under different growth conditions

result.title: Report on the effect of microalgae extracts or compounds on the transcription of skin-related genes using human cell lines.
result.description: Report on the the transcription effect of selected microalgae extracts or compounds on normal human keratinocytes and normal human fibroblasts in vitro using real-time RT-qPCR

result.title: Catalomic profile of microalgae under different culture regimes
result.description: Report on the activities of enzymes of cosmetic importance such as proteases, lipases, superoxide dismutase, catalase, peroxidase, under different growth conditions

result.title: Final project evaluation and assessment report
result.description: Final project evaluation and assessment report including external audits as necessary

result.title: Report on outreach activities to the general public
result.description: Report on the outreach activities aimed towards the general public including articles, videos etc.

result.description: Report on the proceeding and activities of the planned workshops which will be realised with in the project

result.title: Establish the main biological effects of novel nutraceuticals on fish performance
result.description: Report on the main biological effects of novel nutraceuticals on fish performance, including embryos from natural spawning of soles exposed to the biocompound to assess toxicity.

result.description: Report on the training and transfer of knowledge activities and skills obtained through the secondments plan for each secondee.

result.title: Purification and characterization of hatching enzyme
result.description: Report on the development of a proposed method for the purification and subsequent characterization of hatching enzyme, with a possible application in cosmetics

result.teaser: Microalgae are considered an important source of bioactive molecules that can have applications in several fields including nutrition, aquaculture, pharmaceuticals, cosmeceuticals and biofuels. Although microalgae have been commercially cultivated for over 50 years, in depth...

result.title: Glycomic profile of microalgae under different culture regimes
result.description: Report on the yield and quality of polysaccharides production, including polysaccharide isolation, fractionation and structural characterization

result.title: Establish protocols for nutraceuticals administration
result.description: Report on the main biological effects of novel nutraceuticals on fish performance, including larval culture of soles under standard conditions and supplying microcapsules containing compounds until completion of metamorphosis.

result.title: Identification and characterization of high-value added enzymes (proteases, lipases and antioxidant enzymes) with potential applications in cosmetology
result.description: Report on the screening aiming at evaluating substrate specificity and activity of selected enzymes in algae extracts. The study will be focuses only on enzymes with interest in cosmetology

result.title: Purification and structural analysis of selected algae polysaccharides
result.description: Report on the purification and structural analysis of selected algae polysaccharides, including monosaccharide content determined by classical chromatography methods. Special attention will be paid on uronic and sulphate content which often carry the physico-chemical and biological properties of marine polysaccharides.
